thread.title: wakes up to bone-chilling cold on day two of extreme
thread.title_full: Toronto wakes up to bone-chilling cold on day two of extreme cold weather alert | Toronto Star

author: Evelyn Kwong Staff Reporter
title: wakes up to bone-chilling cold on day two of extreme
text:
Bundle up before heading out the door today. Torontonians woke up to numbing temperatures on Thursday on the second day of the extreme cold weather alert  issued by city’s health official.
The coldest point of the day began at 6 a.m. and  is expected to  last throughout the morning, with a temperature of -11C feeling closer to -18C   Sunny skies will continue into the afternoon, but the bone-chilling cold will stretch into the evening, accompanied by a chance of flurries.
The freeze will persist on Friday, with temperatures reaching a low of -11C, feeling like -19C, and a 60 per cent chance of snow in the forecast.
But after a roller coaster week of freezing rain and extreme cold, the weekend forecast is calling for above-average temperatures.
  Saturday’s high will reach a balmy 8C, and low of 3C — well above the average high of -1.8C for February.
Sunday will also see an above-normal high of 5C.
  The city issues extreme cold weather alerts   plunge to -15 C or colder.
“Extreme  
With files from Fakiha Baig .
